column4: ok... i have 2 location questions... where can i get the automatix script at and the winmac script at?
hey pygi.... u wouldn't happen to know where i can get the winmac script from would ya? that one that writes my ntfs drives to my fstab..
jink lots of reasons
and?
would it by chance be a linksys one?
... not familiar with that brand... but i think it might have something to do with your router...
what exactly are you trying to do jahshua?
ahh... then yeah... setup port forwarding on your router
div... how old is your computer?

This computer is 4.5 years old, but the one I've been using (adjacent, Ubuntu locally installed) is ~3 years.  But I talked to tech support and they said that it did not have USB booting support.  I also consider this to be a question with wider implications and if a possible method is found would like to post it for others to use in the future.
Another 'tab' opened up with a message from you.  I've been typing stuff there instead of in this room but aren't sure that you're getting my messages.
nope... haven't receieved any messages... look at the ubuntu servers tab and see if it is saying you can do prv msg because your not registared
Oh, give me a minute to search help on information how to register, etc.
just do /msg nickserv register "password goes here (no quotes)"
then identify urself using the pass
/msg nickserv identify rocket
hows it going... find anything on your compaq mobo?
Heya!
Sort of.  The grub isn't the problem.  I did a ton of research, and found a probably solution here: http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/linux/library/l-fireboot.html
The "two-phase boot" section is the main point of interest.  It seems possible but relies on tweaking kernels and building/burning disk images.
Satan and odat were giving me some advice.  Any of you three curious to help me obtain/edit/build the proper kernel?
